chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Pedro J. Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 19, 2018, that: 
IT IS ORDERED that the judgments are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Melissa Petersen is relieved from further representing Pedro J. Garcia in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
(dated October 23, 2018) *certified*

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Court of Appeals Motion to Lift Hold

IT IS ORDERED that this appeal is held in abeyance pending a decision in State v. Freiboth, NO 2015AP2535-CR.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within ten days after a decision in Freiboth, appellate counsel shall move to lift the hold in this matter and for any other appropriate relief. 
(dated March 7, 2018)

IT IS ORDERED that this appeal is held in abeyance pending a decision in State v. Odom, No. 2015AP2525-CR.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, within ten days after a decision in Odom, Attorney Petersen shall move to lift the hold in this matter and for any other appropriate relief. (order dated February 16, 2018)
